result.execSummary:
The defendant Karla L Greengrass was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

ADDRESS INFO for Karla L Greengrass
Current: W8748 Mission Rd, Black River Falls, WI 54615 United States  (Effective: 09-29-2017)
Prior: W8950 Mission Road, Black River Falls, WI 54615
Payment Plan Request.  Must pay 25% ($247.00) before released.  Then will grant payment plan of $50.00/month beginning 10-28-17.
Payment Plan Request faxed by JASO.
DNA submission form

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State. Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Betthauser.  Victim notification complied with.  Defendant plead guilty to Count 1 in 16CM32 and Misdemeanor Bail Jumping in 15CM278.   All other charges dismissed, but read in for sentencing purposes.  Court advised the possible penalties in the count the defendant plead to.  She understood.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the plea.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently entered her plea and waived her constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty of Misdemeanor Bail Jumping, contrary to 946.49(1)(a) and Domestic Disorderly Conduct, contrary to 947.01(1) and 968.075(1)(a)  Joint recommendation for:  60 days jail.  Each count concurrent.  Credit due.  Court ordered:  60 days jail.  Each count concurrent.  Concurrent to the sanction she is now serving in 13CF134.  Credit for 59 days.  CC.    Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.  Pay CC on or before 8/15.  Or set up payment plan by then.    Failure to pay any part of the fine or court costs in full by the due date will result in 1 day jail for each $25 left unpaid.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 3, 2017 at 10:00 am.

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared through Attorney Betthauser.  Attorney Betthauser will remain on the case.  Request to withdraw as counsel withdrawn by Attorney Betthauser.  Set for plea/sentencing.
Status conference on February 20, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant did not appear for STC.  Attorney Betthauser appeared in court.  Defendant has not contacted Attorney Betthauser.  Warrant authorized.  Attorney Betthauser allowed to withdraw.  Defendant is in custody.  Order to allow Attorney Betthauser to withdraw recinded.  Attorney Betthauser to advise the court.  STC 2/20 at 3 pm
Status conference on February 13, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

Covers 15CM207, 15CM278, 16CM32.  Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.    As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request.    No violent, abusive, threatening or disorderly contact with: A.M.

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.    The defendant appears by video from the Jackson County Jail.  No counsel present.  FTA for plea/sentencing hearing.  Attorney requested withdrawal.  Court advised the defendant to contact Attorney Betthauser as soon as possible.  STC 2/13 at 3 pm.

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Betthauser.  Waive reading of the complaint.  Defendant stood mute.  Court recited the charges and possible penalties.  PTC set for 4/13 and STC set for 5/2.  Bond continued.

Covers 15CM207 and 15CM278.   Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.    As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request.    No violent, abusive, threatening or disorderly contact with: A.M.
